QuestionPrompt: A shopkeeper bought a certain number of articles. He sold 40% of them at a 50% profit, 25% of the remaining at a 20% loss, and 60% of the new remainder at a 25% profit. The rest of the articles, 36 in number, he sold at a 10% loss. If his overall profit was Rs. 4390, what was the cost price of each article?
SolutionExplanation:
Let the total number of articles be N and the cost price of each article be C.
Number of articles in the first batch = 0.4N. Profit on these = 0.4N × C × 0.50 = 0.2NC.
Remaining articles = N - 0.4N = 0.6N.
Number of articles in the second batch = 0.25 × 0.6N = 0.15N. Loss on these = 0.15N × C × 0.20 = 0.03NC.
Remaining articles = 0.6N - 0.15N = 0.45N.
Number of articles in the third batch = 0.60 × 0.45N = 0.27N. Profit on these = 0.27N × C × 0.25 = 0.0675NC.
Number of articles in the fourth batch (rest) = N - (0.4N + 0.15N + 0.27N) = N - 0.82N = 0.18N.
Given that the rest of the articles are 36 in number, so 0.18N = 36.
This means N = 36 / 0.18 = 200 articles.
Loss on the fourth batch = (0.18N) × C × 0.10 = 0.018NC.
Overall profit = 0.2NC - 0.03NC + 0.0675NC - 0.018NC = NC × (0.20 - 0.03 + 0.0675 - 0.018) = 0.2195NC.
Given overall profit = Rs. 4390.
200 × C × 0.2195 = 4390.
43.9C = 4390.
C = 4390 / 43.9 = 100.
The cost price of each article is Rs. 100.
The correct option is (D).

ConceptTested: Arithmetic Progression, Sum of terms properties
DetailedTags: Arithmetic Progression, Sum of terms properties
QuestionPrompt: The sum of the 3rd and 15th elements of an arithmetic progression is equal to the sum of the 6th, 10th, and 12th elements of the same progression. If the 8th element is 21, what is the sum of the first 20 elements of this AP? (TITA)
SolutionExplanation:
Let the arithmetic progression have first term 'a' and common difference 'd'. The n-th term is Tₙ = a + (n-1)d.
Given: T₃ + T₁₅ = T₆ + T₁₀ + T₁₂.
(a + 2d) + (a + 14d) = (a + 5d) + (a + 9d) + (a + 11d).
2a + 16d = 3a + 25d.
a = -9d.
Given: The 8th element T₈ = 21.
T₈ = a + 7d = 21.
Substitute a = -9d: -9d + 7d = 21 => -2d = 21 => d = -10.5.
Then a = -9 × (-10.5) = 94.5.
The sum of the first 20 elements is S₂₀ = (20/2) × [2a + (20-1)d] = 10 × [2a + 19d].
S₂₀ = 10 × [2(94.5) + 19(-10.5)] = 10 × [189 - 199.5] = 10 × [-10.5] = -105.
The sum of the first 20 elements is -105.
SubTopic: Sequences & Series (AP, GP, HP, Special Series)

QuestionPrompt: Let f(x) = |x - 2| + |x - 5| + |x - a|. For what value of 'a' is the sum of the minimum and maximum values of f(x) in the interval [2, 5] equal to 7.5? (The interval [2, 5] includes both 2 and 5).
SolutionExplanation:
For x ∈ [2, 5]:
|x - 2| = x - 2.
|x - 5| = -(x - 5) = 5 - x.
So, f(x) = (x - 2) + (5 - x) + |x - a| = 3 + |x - a|.
Let f_min and f_max be the minimum and maximum values of f(x) on [2, 5].
f_min = 3 + min |x-a| for x in [2,5].
f_max = 3 + max |x-a| for x in [2,5].
Given f_min + f_max = 7.5.
(3 + min |x-a|) + (3 + max |x-a|) = 7.5.
min |x-a| + max |x-a| = 1.5.
The function g(x) = |x-a| measures the distance from x to a. The maximum distance from any point in [2,5] to 'a' will be at one of the endpoints, x=2 or x=5. So, max |x-a| = max(|2-a|, |5-a|).
Case 1: a ∈ [2, 5].
The minimum distance is 0 (at x=a). So min |x-a| = 0.
The equation becomes 0 + max(|2-a|, |5-a|) = 1.5. This means max(a-2, 5-a) = 1.5.
If a-2 = 1.5, then a = 3.5. If 5-a = 1.5, then a = 3.5.
The value a = 3.5 is in [2, 5] and satisfies the condition.
Case 2: a < 2.
min |x-a| is at x=2, value is 2-a. max |x-a| is at x=5, value is 5-a.
Equation: (2-a) + (5-a) = 1.5 => 7 - 2a = 1.5 => 2a = 5.5 => a = 2.75. This contradicts a < 2.
Case 3: a > 5.
min |x-a| is at x=5, value is a-5. max |x-a| is at x=2, value is a-2.
Equation: (a-5) + (a-2) = 1.5 => 2a - 7 = 1.5 => 2a = 8.5 => a = 4.25. This contradicts a > 5.
The only valid solution is a = 3.5.
The correct option is (B).

QuestionPrompt: A and B together can complete a task in 24 days. B and C together can complete the same task in 30 days. A and C together can complete it in 40 days. If A, B, and C work together, but C leaves after 5 days, in how many more days will A and B complete the remaining task? (TITA)
SolutionExplanation:
Let total work be LCM(24, 30, 40) = 120 units.
Rate(A+B) = 120/24 = 5 units/day.
Rate(B+C) = 120/30 = 4 units/day.
Rate(A+C) = 120/40 = 3 units/day.
Adding these: 2(A+B+C) = 5+4+3 = 12. So, Rate(A+B+C) = 6 units/day.
Work done by A, B, and C in 5 days = 5 × 6 = 30 units.
Remaining work = 120 - 30 = 90 units.
This remaining work is completed by A and B. Their combined rate is 5 units/day.
Time taken by A and B = Remaining Work / Rate(A+B) = 90 / 5 = 18 days.
The number of more days is 18.

QuestionPrompt: Two circles with centres O₁ and O₂ touch each other externally at point P. A common tangent to both circles touches them at points A and B respectively. If the radius of the circle with centre O₁ is 9 cm and the radius of the circle with centre O₂ is 4 cm, what is the area of the quadrilateral ABO₂O₁?
SolutionExplanation:
Let r₁ = 9 cm and r₂ = 4 cm.
The distance between centers O₁O₂ = r₁ + r₂ = 9 + 4 = 13 cm.
The length of the direct common tangent AB is √((O₁O₂)² - (r₁ - r₂)²) = √(13² - (9 - 4)²) = √(169 - 25) = √144 = 12 cm.
The quadrilateral ABO₂O₁ is a trapezium with parallel sides O₁A = r₁ and O₂B = r₂, and height AB.
Area = (1/2) × (Sum of parallel sides) × Height
Area = (1/2) × (r₁ + r₂) × AB = (1/2) × (9 + 4) × 12 = (1/2) × 13 × 12 = 78 sq. cm.
The correct option is (A).

ConceptTested: Simple Interest, Compound Interest, Mixed Investment
DetailedTags: Simple Interest, Compound Interest, Mixed Investment
QuestionPrompt: A sum of money is invested in two schemes, A and B. Scheme A offers simple interest at R% per annum and Scheme B offers compound interest at 10% per annum, compounded annually. An amount of Rs. X is invested in Scheme A for 3 years and Rs. (X+4000) is invested in Scheme B for 2 years. The total interest earned from both schemes is Rs. 9960. If R is 12%, find the value of X.
SolutionExplanation:
Interest from Scheme A (SI): I_A = X × (12/100) × 3 = 0.36X.
Interest from Scheme B (CI): Amount_B = (X+4000) × (1 + 10/100)² = (X+4000) × 1.21.
I_B = Amount_B - P_B = (X+4000) × (1.21 - 1) = 0.21(X+4000) = 0.21X + 840.
Total interest I_A + I_B = 0.36X + 0.21X + 840 = 0.57X + 840.
Given total interest = 9960.
0.57X + 840 = 9960.
0.57X = 9120.
X = 9120 / 0.57 = 912000 / 57 = 16000.
The value of X is Rs. 16000.
The correct option is (C).

ConceptTested: Area of rectangle, Area of crossroads
DetailedTags: Area of rectangle, Area of crossroads
QuestionPrompt: A rectangular park is 120 m long and 80 m wide. It has two concrete crossroads running in the middle of the park, one parallel to the length and the other parallel to the width. The width of both crossroads is 5 m. The rest of the park is covered with grass. If the cost of laying grass is Rs. 15 per sq. m, find the total cost of laying grass in the park.
SolutionExplanation:
Total area of the park = 120 m × 80 m = 9600 sq. m.
Area of crossroad parallel to length = 120 × 5 = 600 sq. m.
Area of crossroad parallel to width = 80 × 5 = 400 sq. m.
Area of the overlapping square at the center = 5 × 5 = 25 sq. m.
Total area of crossroads = 600 + 400 - 25 = 975 sq. m.
Area covered by grass = Total area - Area of crossroads = 9600 - 975 = 8625 sq. m.
Total cost of laying grass = 8625 × 15 = Rs. 129,375.
The correct option is (C).
SubTopic: Mensuration - 2D (Area & Perimeter: Triangles, Quadrilaterals, Polygons, Circles)

ConceptTested: Relative speed, Time and distance calculation
DetailedTags: Relative speed, Time and distance calculation
QuestionPrompt: A journey of 900 km was partly covered by train at a speed of 90 km/hr and partly by car at a speed of 60 km/hr. If the train journey was 30 minutes longer than the car journey, find the distance covered by the car (in km). (TITA)
SolutionExplanation:
Let the time taken for the car journey be T_c hours. Then the time for the train journey T_t = T_c + 0.5 hours.
Distance by car D_c = 60 × T_c.
Distance by train D_t = 90 × T_t = 90 × (T_c + 0.5).
Total distance D_c + D_t = 900.
60 T_c + 90(T_c + 0.5) = 900.
60 T_c + 90 T_c + 45 = 900.
150 T_c = 855.
T_c = 855 / 150 = 5.7 hours.
Distance covered by car D_c = 60 × T_c = 60 × 5.7 = 342 km.
The distance covered by the car is 342 km.

QuestionPrompt: The value of x for which the inequality (x² - 5x + 6) / (|x - 1| - 3) < 0 holds true is:
SolutionExplanation:
Let f(x) = (x² - 5x + 6) / (|x - 1| - 3). We need to find the values of x for which f(x) < 0.
1. Analyze the Numerator (N(x)):
   N(x) = x² - 5x + 6 = (x-2)(x-3).
   The roots of the numerator are x = 2 and x = 3.
2. Analyze the Denominator (D(x)):
   D(x) = |x - 1| - 3.
   The denominator is zero when |x - 1| = 3.
   This gives two possibilities: x - 1 = 3 => x = 4; or x - 1 = -3 => x = -2.
   The function is undefined at x = -2 and x = 4.
3. Identify Critical Points:
   The critical points are -2, 2, 3, 4. These points divide the number line into five intervals.
4. Sign Analysis (Wavy Curve Method):
   We check the sign of f(x) in each interval.
   *   Interval (-∞, -2): Pick x = -3. N(-3) > 0, D(-3) > 0. f(x) is Positive.
   *   Interval (-2, 2): Pick x = 0. N(0) > 0, D(0) < 0. f(x) is **Negative**.
   *   Interval (2, 3): Pick x = 2.5. N(2.5) < 0, D(2.5) < 0. f(x) is Positive.
   *   Interval (3, 4): Pick x = 3.5. N(3.5) > 0, D(3.5) < 0. f(x) is **Negative**.
   *   Interval (4, ∞): Pick x = 5. N(5) > 0, D(5) > 0. f(x) is Positive.
5. Conclusion:
   The inequality f(x) < 0 holds for the intervals where f(x) is negative.
   Combining the solution intervals: (-2, 2) ∪ (3, 4).
The correct option is (C).

QuestionPrompt: A bag contains 5 red balls, 4 blue balls, and 3 green balls. Three balls are drawn at random without replacement. What is the probability that exactly two of the drawn balls are red and one is blue?
SolutionExplanation:
Total balls = 5R + 4B + 3G = 12.
Total ways to draw 3 balls from 12 = C(12, 3) = (12×11×10)/(3×2×1) = 220.
Favorable ways = (Choose 2 Red from 5) AND (Choose 1 Blue from 4).
Number of favorable ways = C(5, 2) × C(4, 1) = 10 × 4 = 40.
Probability = (Favorable Ways) / (Total Ways) = 40 / 220 = 4/22 = 2/11.
The correct option is (A).

ConceptTested: Area of similar triangles, Ratio of sides
DetailedTags: Area of similar triangles, Ratio of sides
QuestionPrompt: In a triangle ABC, D and E are points on sides AB and AC respectively such that AD = 2 BD and AE:EC = 3:2. If the area of triangle ADE is 48 sq. cm, what is the area of triangle ABC?
SolutionExplanation:
The ratio of areas Area(ADE) / Area(ABC) = (AD/AB) × (AE/AC).
Given AD = 2 BD, so AD/BD = 2/1. This means AB = AD + BD = AD + 0.5 AD = 1.5 AD. So, AD/AB = AD/(1.5 AD) = 2/3.
Given AE:EC = 3:2. This means AC = AE + EC = AE + (2/3)AE = (5/3)AE. So, AE/AC = AE/((5/3)AE) = 3/5.
Area(ADE) / Area(ABC) = (2/3) × (3/5) = 2/5.
Given Area(ADE) = 48 sq. cm.
48 / Area(ABC) = 2/5.
Area(ABC) = 48 × (5/2) = 120 sq. cm.
The correct option is (D).

ConceptTested: Principle of Inclusion-Exclusion, Exactly two sets
DetailedTags: Principle of Inclusion-Exclusion, Exactly two sets
QuestionPrompt: In a survey of 200 people, it was found that 120 read Newspaper A, 90 read Newspaper B, and 70 read Newspaper C. 40 read both A and B, 30 read both B and C, 50 read both A and C, and 20 read all three. How many people read exactly two newspapers? (TITA)
SolutionExplanation:
Number of people who read exactly two newspapers is:
(|A∩B| + |B∩C| + |A∩C|) - 3 × |A∩B∩C|
= (40 + 30 + 50) - 3 × 20
= 120 - 60 = 60.
The number of people who read exactly two newspapers is 60.

QuestionPrompt: If the roots of the quadratic equation x² – (k+2)x + (k²+3k+2) = 0 are α and β, and (α - β)² = N, where N is a non-negative integer. Find the sum of all possible integer values of k for which the roots α, β are real and N ≤ 1. (TITA)
SolutionExplanation:
The equation is x² – (k+2)x + (k+1)(k+2) = 0. Roots are α, β.
α+β = k+2, αβ = (k+1)(k+2).
For real roots, Discriminant D ≥ 0. D = (α-β)².
D = (α+β)² - 4αβ = (k+2)² - 4(k+1)(k+2) = (k+2)[(k+2) - 4(k+1)] = (k+2)(-3k-2) = -(k+2)(3k+2).
Condition for real roots: -(k+2)(3k+2) ≥ 0 => (k+2)(3k+2) ≤ 0.
This holds for k ∈ [-2, -2/3].
Given N = (α-β)² = D = -(k+2)(3k+2), where N is a non-negative integer and N ≤ 1.
Case N=0: -(k+2)(3k+2) = 0. Integer solution is k = -2. This is in the valid range.
Case N=1: -(k+2)(3k+2) = 1 => 3k²+8k+5 = 0 => (3k+5)(k+1)=0. Integer solution is k = -1. This is in the valid range [-2, -2/3].
The possible integer values of k are -2 and -1.
Sum = -2 + (-1) = -3.

ConceptTested: Right-angled triangle, Perimeter, Sum of squares of sides
DetailedTags: Right-angled triangle, Perimeter, Sum of squares of sides
QuestionPrompt: The perimeter of a right-angled triangle is 132 cm and the sum of the squares of its sides is 6050 cm². What is the length of the hypotenuse of the triangle?
SolutionExplanation:
Let the sides be a, b and hypotenuse h.
a + b + h = 132.
a² + b² + h² = 6050.
Since a² + b² = h² (Pythagorean theorem), we have h² + h² = 6050.
2h² = 6050 => h² = 3025.
h = √3025 = 55 cm.
The correct option is (A).

ConceptTested: Arithmetic Progression, N-th term from sum
DetailedTags: Arithmetic Progression, N-th term from sum
QuestionPrompt: The sum of the first 'n' terms of an arithmetic progression is given by Sₙ = 3n² + 5n. If the k-th term of this AP is 122, what is the value of k? (TITA)
SolutionExplanation:
Given Sₙ = 3n² + 5n.
The n-th term Tₙ = Sₙ - Sₙ₋₁ (for n ≥ 2).
Tₙ = (3n² + 5n) - [3(n-1)² + 5(n-1)]
Tₙ = (3n² + 5n) - [3(n²-2n+1) + 5n-5]
Tₙ = (3n² + 5n) - (3n²-n-2) = 6n + 2.
This formula also works for n=1, since T₁ = S₁ = 3(1)²+5(1) = 8, and the formula gives 6(1)+2 = 8.
Given Tₖ = 122.
6k + 2 = 122 => 6k = 120 => k = 20.
The value of k is 20.
SubTopic: Sequences & Series (AP, GP, HP, Special Series)

QuestionPrompt: If x and y are positive real numbers such that log₈(x³) + log₄(y²) = 7 and logₓ(8) - logᵧ(4) = 1, then the value of xy is:
SolutionExplanation:
The first equation is log₈(x³) + log₄(y²) = 7.
Using log_{a^m}(b^n) = (n/m)log_a(b):
log_{2³}(x³) + log_{2²}(y²) = 7.
(3/3)log₂(x) + (2/2)log₂(y) = 7.
log₂(x) + log₂(y) = 7.
log₂(xy) = 7.
xy = 2⁷ = 128.
The second equation is not required to find the value of xy.
The correct option is (B).

QuestionPrompt: Let N be the largest four-digit number which when divided by 12, 15, 20 and 24 leaves remainders 8, 11, 16 and 20 respectively. What is the sum of the digits of N?
SolutionExplanation:
The differences between divisors and remainders are:
12-8=4, 15-11=4, 20-16=4, 24-20=4.
The common difference is 4.
So, N = k × LCM(12, 15, 20, 24) - 4.
LCM(12, 15, 20, 24) = LCM(2²×3, 3×5, 2²×5, 2³×3) = 2³×3×5 = 120.
N = 120k - 4.
We need the largest 4-digit number. 9999 / 120 ≈ 83.3.
So, the largest integer k is 83.
N = 120 × 83 - 4 = 9960 - 4 = 9956.
Sum of digits of N = 9 + 9 + 5 + 6 = 29.
The correct option is (D).

QuestionPrompt: What is the smallest positive integer k such that 2026^k leaves a remainder of 1 when divided by 23? (TITA)
SolutionExplanation:
We need to find the smallest positive integer k such that 2026^k ≡ 1 (mod 23).
First, find 2026 mod 23. 2026 = 23 × 88 + 2.
So, 2026 ≡ 2 (mod 23).
The problem is now to find the smallest k such that 2^k ≡ 1 (mod 23).
By Fermat's Little Theorem, 2²² ≡ 1 (mod 23). So k must be a divisor of 22.
Divisors of 22 are 1, 2, 11, 22.
k=1: 2¹ ≡ 2 (mod 23).
k=2: 2² ≡ 4 (mod 23).
k=11: 2⁵ = 32 ≡ 9. 2¹⁰ ≡ 9² = 81 ≡ 12 (since 81 = 3×23+12). 2¹¹ ≡ 2¹⁰×2 ≡ 12×2 = 24 ≡ 1 (mod 23).
The smallest positive integer k is 11.

QuestionPrompt: A bus travels from point P to point Q. On a particular day, it covers the first 40% of the distance in 50% of its scheduled time. It then encounters a delay of 'd' minutes. To arrive at Q on schedule, it has to increase its speed by 50% of its original scheduled speed for the rest of the journey. If the scheduled time for the entire journey was 2 hours 30 minutes, find the value of 'd'.
SolutionExplanation:
Let total distance be D and scheduled time T_sch = 2.5 hours = 150 minutes.
Original speed S_orig = D / 150.
Part 1: Distance d₁ = 0.4D. Time taken t₁ = 0.5 × 150 = 75 minutes.
Remaining distance d₂ = 0.6D.
Time remaining in the schedule for this part = 150 - 75 = 75 minutes.
Due to a delay of 'd' minutes, the time available is (75 - d) minutes.
New speed for the rest of the journey S₂ = 1.5 S_orig.
Time taken for the second part is t₂ = d₂ / S₂ = 0.6D / (1.5 S_orig) = 0.6D / (1.5 * (D/150)) = (0.6 * 150) / 1.5 = 60 minutes.
This time taken must equal the available time.
60 = 75 - d.
d = 15 minutes.
The correct option is (B).

QuestionPrompt: A solid metallic sphere of radius 10.5 cm is melted and recast into a number of smaller identical cones, each of radius 3.5 cm and height 3 cm. What is the maximum number of such cones that can be formed? (Use π = 22/7) (TITA)
SolutionExplanation:
Volume of sphere V_sph = (4/3)πR³ = (4/3)π(10.5)³.
Volume of one cone V_cone = (1/3)πr²h = (1/3)π(3.5)²(3) = π(3.5)².
Number of cones N = V_sph / V_cone = [(4/3)π(10.5)³] / [π(3.5)²].
N = (4/3) × (10.5/3.5)² × 10.5 = (4/3) × 3² × 10.5 = 4 × 3 × 10.5 = 12 × 10.5 = 126.
The maximum number of such cones is 126.
SubTopic: Mensuration - 3D (Volume & Surface Area: Cubes, Cuboids, Cylinders, Cones, Spheres, Prisms, Pyramids, Frustum)

QuestionPrompt: A container has a mixture of milk and water in the ratio 7:3. If 20 litres of this mixture is removed and replaced with 20 litres of water, the ratio of milk to water becomes 7:5. What was the initial quantity of milk in the container (in litres)?
SolutionExplanation:
Let the initial quantities of milk and water be 7k and 3k. Total = 10k.
In 20 litres of mixture removed, milk removed = (7/10)×20 = 14 L, water removed = (3/10)×20 = 6 L.
Remaining milk = 7k - 14. Remaining water = 3k - 6.
20 litres of water is added.
New milk = 7k - 14. New water = (3k - 6) + 20 = 3k + 14.
New ratio is (7k - 14) / (3k + 14) = 7/5.
7(k - 2) / (3k + 14) = 7/5.
(k - 2) / (3k + 14) = 1/5.
5(k - 2) = 3k + 14 => 5k - 10 = 3k + 14 => 2k = 24 => k = 12.
Initial quantity of milk = 7k = 7 × 12 = 84 litres.
The correct option is (B).

QuestionPrompt: How many 5-digit numbers can be formed using the digits 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 such that the number is divisible by 5 and no digit is repeated?
SolutionExplanation:
The 5-digit number must be divisible by 5, so the last digit is 0 or 5. Digits {0,1,2,3,4,5} are available and cannot be repeated.
Case 1: Unit digit is 0.
The positions are: _ _ _ _ 0.
The first digit can be chosen from {1,2,3,4,5} (5 choices).
The remaining 3 positions can be filled from the remaining 4 digits in P(4,3) ways.
Number of ways = 5 × P(4,3) = 5 × (4×3×2) = 120.
Case 2: Unit digit is 5.
The positions are: _ _ _ _ 5.
The first digit cannot be 0 or 5. It can be chosen from {1,2,3,4} (4 choices).
The remaining 3 positions can be filled from the remaining 4 digits (which include 0) in P(4,3) ways.
Number of ways = 4 × P(4,3) = 4 × (4×3×2) = 96.
Total numbers = Case 1 + Case 2 = 120 + 96 = 216.
The correct option is (B).
